page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content:
PORTADOWN IS A LARGE COMMERCIAL TOWN WITH A POPULATION OF 21,333. IT DERIVES ITS NAME FROM THE IRISH PORT-NE-DUN (PORT OF THE FORTRESS) AND HAS ALWAYS BEEN DESCRIBED AS "THE HUB OF THE NORTH". IT IS SITUATED SOUTH OF LOUGH NEAGH ON THE BANKS OF THE RIVER BANN ABOUT 30 MILES FROM BELFAST.
IT OWES ITS DEVELOPMENT ORIGINALLY TO NEWRY CANAL AND IN MORE RECENT YEARS TO ITS LOCATION SITTING ASTRIDE MAJOR ROAD AND RAIL SYSTEMS, THE M1 MOTORWAY AND THE MAIN BELFAST TO DUBLIN RAILWAY. THE TOWN'S POSITION HAS AIDED ITS INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT AND WITHIN OUR AREA THERE ARE SEVERAL MANUFACTURING ESTABLISHMENTS THE PRINCIPAL ONE BEING THE METAL BOX COMPANY ON THE BROWNSTOWN ROAD.
